info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:55PM EDT until August 06 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LOUISA...NORTHWESTERN CHESTERFIELD...SOUTHEASTERN GOOCHLAND...NORTHWESTERN HENRICO...NORTHWESTERN HANOVER...NORTH CENTRAL AMELIA AND POWHATAN COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 654 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oilville to near Sabot to Chula, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Moseley, Montpelier, Chula, Manakin, and Sabot around 700 PM EDT. Tuckahoe and Wyndham around 705 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Crozier, Rock Castle, Pilkinton, Vontay, Maidens, Irwin, Johnsons Springs, Elmont, Winterham, and Skinquarter. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
